TopicTitle: Kethane Pack 0.9.2 - New cinematic trailer! - 1.0 compatibility update

Articles.Content:
Avast is saying that the download page has a risk of giving me a virus.

Its a false positive.

I would like to see something like this. The EL ore scanner is interesting because it is huge (over 2.5m), forces the end of stack (if placed there), and heavy (4 tons). I had quite a time building something that could scan at 1000x and not miss a hex. But it was fun trying. I'd love to see something that big for Kethane that could scan maybe four times better (and maybe even wider) than the current large scanner, as long as it was a real challenge to deploy any number of them. Make us work for the privilege.

Majiir, I'm curious your thoughts on this direction. Is it worth considering you think?

I'd like to see Kethane going the other direction, making probe size converters, inline tanks, and drills. The ability to have a smallish ion probe and an even smaller refueling kethane miner would be awesome. Self contained probe kethane fed grand tour.

I'd like to see Kethane going the other direction, making probe size converters, inline tanks, and drills. The ability to have a smallish ion probe and an even smaller refueling kethane miner would be awesome. Self contained probe kethane fed grand tour.

I had a need for a probe sized drill for "soil sampling", so I re-sized the radial attach drill. It was effective, however it did not seem quite right.

Sorry if i missed it earlier in the posts, but how long can a pipe segment be?

thanks.
Isnt working for me i place the Kethane folder into Gamedata but when i enter then game ill i get is the parts, nothing else works can anyone help?
Tried looking around but couldn't find any info - Are mods compatible with the .22 research system? Kethane would be the best one for it if so.

Tried looking around but couldn't find any info - Are mods compatible with the .22 research system? Kethane would be the best one for it if so.

I'm sure the mod developers will need to see how the system works before they can make their mods compatible...

Just a thought, what if when you 'recover' a vessel from kerbin, you retrieve all it's kethane? As in, if you have a driller with 100 units of kethane, and you recover it, if you make a new vessel with kethane storage, the kethane will be transferred to that vessel.

Just seemed like a neat idea.

Local cross-eyed madman, Andred Kermin, discovers Kethane on Minmus! World shocked!!

~Steve

Is there any way to get the old style maps back? Was easier to use that in conjunction with mapsat to find good landing sites.

Has anyone else had these issues with Kubuntu 64bit 13.04?

When using the Tracking Center with Kethane Grid turned on game the game crashes. (I would have to start a new mission to turn the Grid off)

Both Kethane miners cause a game crashe when I start a mission. I can't mine any kethane deposits because of this.
Any plans to have the scanned grid show up in Tracking instead of the all empty one?

Has anyone else had these issues with Kubuntu 64bit 13.04?

Have you patched your KSP executable to account for the PNG issues on Linux? Kethane uses some PNG textures, in particular for particle effects.

Any plans to have the scanned grid show up in Tracking instead of the all empty one?

The grid appears in the tracking station and flight view, and it's the same grid (i.e. it shows you what you've scanned).

No I haven't patched for the PNG issue. That could also explain another bug that I've been having.

Is there a thread that you could direct me to Majiir?

Is there anyway to reset Kethane deposits? I would like to set up a ground based refueling network around KSC for aircraft but there are no deposits near by.

In your save folder (not game data) you'll find a kethane.cfg file. You can delete that and the plugin will regenerate that file again with new random deposits.

DO NOT DELETE THE WRONG KETHANE.CFG FILE! There are at least two files with the same name from memory - perhaps a rename is better than a delete until you're sure you got that right.
